alert.note: Alert for Southern Westchester (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 16 at 4:18AM EDT until September 16 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...A reasonable worst case of up to 1 foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...In Connecticut, Southern Fairfield, Southern New Haven, Southern Middlesex and Southern New London Counties. In New York, Southern Westchester County. * WHEN...Through this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Some roads and low lying properties including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience minor flooding. * FORECAST CHALLENGES...There is still uncertainty in the timing of peak surge relative to the times of high tide today, the magnitude of wave setup effects over several tidal cycles, and the fact that Lee is moving to the northeast of the region. For these reasons, this coastal flood forecast represents a reasonable worst case forecast.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.
